Text editors.name: Atom
Text editors.description: A hackable text editor for the 21st Century
Text editors.comment: Really appreciated by a lot of people, but I think that Visual Studio Code is just way better.

Text editors.name: Gedit
Text editors.description: Text editor of the GNOME desktop environment
Text editors.comment: Lightweight and fast to open, it's my editor for on-the-go edits.

Text editors.name: Visual Studio Code
Text editors.comment: Awesome compromise between a text editor and a heavy IDE. Improved by a huge number a plugins.

JetBrains IDEs.name: Android Studio
JetBrains IDEs.comment: Must-have for Android development. Awesome but heavy (like every JetBrain tool ever).

JetBrains IDEs.name: Clion
JetBrains IDEs.description: A cross-platform IDE for C and C++
JetBrains IDEs.comment: The best IDE for C and C++. Awesome but heavy (like every JetBrain tool ever).

JetBrains IDEs.name: IntelliJ IDEA Community
JetBrains IDEs.comment: Java sucks less with it. Awesome but heavy (like every JetBrain tool ever), but even heavier since it's Java. Free version, but with less features.

JetBrains IDEs.name: IntelliJ IDEA Ultimate
JetBrains IDEs.description: Capable and Ergonomic Java IDE for Entreprise, Web and Mobile Development
JetBrains IDEs.comment: Java sucks less with it. Awesome but heavy (like every JetBrain tool ever), but even heavier since it's Java.

JetBrains IDEs.name: Pycharm Community
JetBrains IDEs.comment: Awesome but heavy (like every JetBrain tool ever). Free version, but with less features.

JetBrains IDEs.name: Pycharm Pro
JetBrains IDEs.description: The Python IDE for Professional Developers
JetBrains IDEs.comment: Awesome but heavy (like every JetBrain tool ever).

JetBrains IDEs.name: RubyMine
JetBrains IDEs.description: The Most Intelligent Ruby and Rails IDE

JetBrains IDEs.name: WebStorm
JetBrains IDEs.comment: Works fine, but VSCode is free, lighter and almost as good.

File managers.name: Dolphin
File managers.comment: I consider Nautilus more intuitive and beautiful.

File managers.name: Nautilus
File managers.description: File explorer of the GNOME desktop environment
File managers.comment: My favorite file explorer. Simple, intuitive, beautiful.

Graphisme tools.name: Gcolor3
Graphisme tools.description: Pick colors from the selector or the screen. A.K.A Color Picker.
Graphisme tools.comment: Useful for picking colors from everywhere.

Graphisme tools.name: GIMP
Graphisme tools.comment: Hard to learn. Hard to master. No compromise, just power.

Multimedia tools.name: Shotwell
Multimedia tools.comment: Nice to look at images and crop them.

Multimedia tools.name: VLC
Multimedia tools.description: VLC media player, the open-source multimedia player
Multimedia tools.comment: Must-have to be able to open everything.

Productivity and office tools.name: FreeOffice
Productivity and office tools.description: A complete, reliable, lightning-fast and Microsoft Office-compatible office suite with a word processor, spreadsheet, and presentation graphics software.

Productivity and office tools.name: LibreOffice
Productivity and office tools.comment: Microsoft Office is better, but not available on Linux.

Productivity and office tools.name: Toggl Track
Productivity and office tools.description: Simple and Intuitive Time Tracking Software
Productivity and office tools.comment: My favorite time tracking tool. Free, simple and synchronized on web. Available later.

Productivity and office tools.name: SimpleNote
Productivity and office tools.description: The simplest way to keep notes.
Productivity and office tools.comment: My favorite notepad. Free, simple and synchronized on web.

Social.name: Discord
Social.description: All-in-one voice and text chat for gamers that's free, secure, and works on both your desktop and phone.

System tools.name: Filelight
System tools.description: Filelight creates an interactive map to show the disk utilisation of your computer
System tools.comment: Useful to visualise what takes you space on your disk.

System tools.name: Gnome System Monitor
System tools.comment: Useful to visualise what uses your RAM, CPU, GPU and network.

System tools.name: Timeshift
System tools.description: A system restore utility for Linux

Terminal emulator.name: Gnome Terminal
Terminal emulator.comment: I used it for a long time, but Konsole have a better support of ZSH.

Terminal emulator.name: Konsole
Terminal emulator.comment: My favorite Terminal Emulator. Fully support everything I need.

Web browsers.name: Chromium
Web browsers.description: Chromium web browser, open-source version of Chrome
Web browsers.comment: I never used it, I like the Mozilla philosophy.

Web browsers.name: Tor Browser Launcher
Web browsers.description: A program to help you download, keep updated, and run the Tor Browser Bundle
Web browsers.comment: Must-have if you care about yourself.

Others.name: Simple Screen Recorder
Others.description: A feature-rich screen recorder that supports X11 and OpenGL
Others.comment: Easy to use and works fine.

Others.name: ZSH
Others.description: A very advanced and programmable command interpreter (shell) for UNIX
Others.comment: Beautiful, useful, with a lot of nice plugins. Is on every UNIX rice.
